entities.name: dursleys
entities.description: The Dursleys are Harry's relatives who treat him poorly. They are mentioned as the ones who haven't remembered Harry's birthday and never give him proper presents.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story, a boy who is being treated poorly by his relatives. He is mentioned as having a birthday that was ignored by the Dursleys.

entities.name: school year
entities.description: The school year is mentioned as being over, indicating that Harry has finished his academic year and is now on summer break.

relationships.description: The Dursleys treat Harry poorly, as mentioned in the text. They ignore his birthday and never give him proper presents.
The Dursleys ignore Harry's birthday, as mentioned in the text. This is an example of a bidirectional relationship, where the Dursleys both treat Harry poorly and ignore his birthday.
